fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: FilmsConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description:
A count of the total number of objects in this connection, ignoring pagination.
This allows a client to fetch the first five objects by passing "5" as the
argument to "first", then fetch the total count so it could display "5 of 83",
for example.

fields.name: films
fields.description:
A list of all of the objects returned in the connection. This is a convenience
field provided for quickly exploring the API; rather than querying for
"{ edges { node } }" when no edge data is needed, this field can be be used
instead. Note that when clients like Relay need to fetch the "cursor" field on
the edge to enable efficient pagination, this shortcut cannot be used, and the
full "{ edges { node } }" version should be used instead.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: FilmsEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: Film
types.description: A single film.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this film.

fields.name: episodeID
fields.description: The episode number of this film.

fields.name: openingCrawl
fields.description: The opening paragraphs at the beginning of this film.

fields.name: director
fields.description: The name of the director of this film.

fields.name: producers
fields.description: The name(s) of the producer(s) of this film.

fields.name: releaseDate
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of film release at original creator country.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the object.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

A count of the total number of objects in this connection, ignoring pagination.
This allows a client to fetch the first five objects by passing "5" as the
argument to "first", then fetch the total count so it could display "5 of 83",

A list of all of the objects returned in the connection. This is a convenience

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: Species
types.description: A type of person or character within the Star Wars Universe.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this species.

fields.name: classification
fields.description: The classification of this species, such as "mammal" or "reptile".

fields.name: designation
fields.description: The designation of this species, such as "sentient".

fields.name: averageHeight
fields.description: The average height of this species in centimeters.

fields.name: averageLifespan
fields.description: The average lifespan of this species in years, null if unknown.

fields.name: eyeColors
fields.description:
Common eye colors for this species, null if this species does not typically
have eyes.

fields.name: hairColors
fields.description:
Common hair colors for this species, null if this species does not typically
have hair.

fields.name: skinColors
fields.description:
Common skin colors for this species, null if this species does not typically
have skin.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language commonly spoken by this species.

fields.name: homeworld
fields.description: A planet that this species originates from.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Planet
types.description:
A large mass, planet or planetoid in the Star Wars Universe, at the time of
0 ABY.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this planet.

fields.name: diameter
fields.description: The diameter of this planet in kilometers.

fields.name: rotationPeriod
fields.description:
The number of standard hours it takes for this planet to complete a single
rotation on its axis.

fields.name: orbitalPeriod
fields.description:
The number of standard days it takes for this planet to complete a single orbit
of its local star.

fields.name: gravity
fields.description:
A number denoting the gravity of this planet, where "1" is normal or 1 standard
G. "2" is twice or 2 standard Gs. "0.5" is half or 0.5 standard Gs.

fields.name: population
fields.description: The average population of sentient beings inhabiting this planet.

fields.name: climates
fields.description: The climates of this planet.

fields.name: terrains
fields.description: The terrains of this planet.

fields.name: surfaceWater
fields.description:
The percentage of the planet surface that is naturally occuring water or bodies
of water.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.description:

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: Person
types.description: An individual person or character within the Star Wars universe.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this person.

fields.name: birthYear
fields.description:
The birth year of the person, using the in-universe standard of BBY or ABY -
Before the Battle of Yavin or After the Battle of Yavin. The Battle of Yavin is
a battle that occurs at the end of Star Wars episode IV: A New Hope.

fields.name: eyeColor
fields.description:
The eye color of this person. Will be "unknown" if not known or "n/a" if the
person does not have an eye.

fields.name: gender
fields.description:
The gender of this person. Either "Male", "Female" or "unknown",
"n/a" if the person does not have a gender.

fields.name: hairColor
fields.description:
The hair color of this person. Will be "unknown" if not known or "n/a" if the
person does not have hair.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the person in centimeters.

fields.name: mass
fields.description: The mass of the person in kilograms.

fields.name: skinColor
fields.description: The skin color of this person.

fields.name: homeworld
fields.description: A planet that this person was born on or inhabits.

fields.name: species
fields.description: The species that this person belongs to, or null if unknown.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: Starship
types.description: A single transport craft that has hyperdrive capability.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this starship. The common name, such as "Death Star".

fields.name: model
fields.description:
The model or official name of this starship. Such as "T-65 X-wing" or "DS-1
Orbital Battle Station".

fields.name: starshipClass
fields.description:
The class of this starship, such as "Starfighter" or "Deep Space Mobile
Battlestation"

fields.name: manufacturers
fields.description: The manufacturers of this starship.

fields.name: costInCredits
fields.description: The cost of this starship new, in galactic credits.

fields.name: length
fields.description: The length of this starship in meters.

fields.name: crew
fields.description: The number of personnel needed to run or pilot this starship.

fields.name: passengers
fields.description: The number of non-essential people this starship can transport.

fields.name: maxAtmospheringSpeed
fields.description:
The maximum speed of this starship in atmosphere. null if this starship is
incapable of atmosphering flight.

fields.name: hyperdriveRating
fields.description: The class of this starships hyperdrive.

fields.name: MGLT
fields.description:
The Maximum number of Megalights this starship can travel in a standard hour.
A "Megalight" is a standard unit of distance and has never been defined before
within the Star Wars universe. This figure is only really useful for measuring
the difference in speed of starships. We can assume it is similar to AU, the
distance between our Sun (Sol) and Earth.

fields.name: cargoCapacity
fields.description: The maximum number of kilograms that this starship can transport.

fields.name: consumables
fields.description:
The maximum length of time that this starship can provide consumables for its
entire crew without having to resupply.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.name: edited
fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

types.name: Vehicle
types.description: A single transport craft that does not have hyperdrive capability

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of this vehicle. The common name, such as "Sand Crawler" or "Speeder
bike".

fields.name: model
fields.description:
The model or official name of this vehicle. Such as "All-Terrain Attack
Transport".

fields.name: vehicleClass
fields.description: The class of this vehicle, such as "Wheeled" or "Repulsorcraft".

fields.name: manufacturers
fields.description: The manufacturers of this vehicle.

fields.name: costInCredits
fields.description: The cost of this vehicle new, in Galactic Credits.

fields.name: length
fields.description: The length of this vehicle in meters.

fields.name: crew
fields.description: The number of personnel needed to run or pilot this vehicle.

fields.name: passengers
fields.description: The number of non-essential people this vehicle can transport.

fields.name: maxAtmospheringSpeed
fields.description: The maximum speed of this vehicle in atmosphere.

fields.name: cargoCapacity
fields.description: The maximum number of kilograms that this vehicle can transport.

fields.name: consumables
fields.description:
The maximum length of time that this vehicle can provide consumables for its
entire crew without having to resupply.

fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was created.

fields.description: The ISO 8601 date format of the time that this resource was edited.

fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description:
A count of the total number of objects in this connection, ignoring pagination.
This allows a client to fetch the first five objects by passing "5" as the
argument to "first", then fetch the total count so it could display "5 of 83",
for example.

fields.name: planets
fields.description:
A list of all of the objects returned in the connection. This is a convenience
field provided for quickly exploring the API; rather than querying for
"{ edges { node } }" when no edge data is needed, this field can be be used
instead. Note that when clients like Relay need to fetch the "cursor" field on
the edge to enable efficient pagination, this shortcut cannot be used, and the
full "{ edges { node } }" version should be used instead.

types.name: FilmPlanetsEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
